metadata.Title: CVE-2019-15846 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - high.
metadata.Description:
Exim before 4.92.2 allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code as root via a trailing backslash. It was discovered that Exim incorrectly handled certain decoding operations. A remote attacker could possibly use this issue to execute arbitrary commands.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-15846` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

exim4 - 4.90.1-1ubuntu1.4
exim4-base - 4.90.1-1ubuntu1.4
exim4-config - 4.90.1-1ubuntu1.4
exim4-daemon-heavy - 4.90.1-1ubuntu1.4
exim4-daemon-light - 4.90.1-1ubuntu1.4
eximon4 - 4.90.1-1ubuntu1.4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: exim4 package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.90.1-1ubuntu1.4').
